sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has one parallel side of length 8 cm and another parallel side of length 12 cm. The two non-parallel sides are each 5 cm long. What is the perimeter of this trapezium in centimeters?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply add the lengths of all four sides. Since the two non-parallel sides are each 5 cm long, we have:

Perimeter = 8 cm (first parallel side) + 12 cm (second parallel side) + 5 cm (first non-parallel side) + 5 cm (second non-parallel side)
Perimeter = 8 + 12 + 5 + 5
Perimeter = 30 cm

So, the perimeter of the trapezium is 30 centimeters.
